member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession
member.summary: Enables other VS extensions to interact with a Live Share session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.SessionId
member.summary: Globally unique identifier for the current session, or null if there is no current session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.ConversationId
member.summary: Globally unique identifier for the current conversation within a session, or null if there is no current session. Regular sessions will only have one conversation. Persistent sessions may have multiple.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.IsSessionConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether collaboration session is connected. Only implemented for CollaborationSession within VS.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.SessionDisconnection
member.summary: Gets a task that is completed when the session is disconnected. Only implemented for CollaborationSession within VS.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.Peers
member.summary: List of participants connected to the current sharing session, NOT including oneself.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.PeersChanged
member.summary: Event that notifies listeners when peers join or leave the session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.OnPeersChanged(Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeersChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises a event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.GetService(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets a local service that is available in the context of the Live Share session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.RemoteServiceNames
member.summary: Gets a collection of service names that are shared by the remote Host, when this session is connected as a Guest.
member.remarks: This collection is empty when the current session is in the Host role, so it does not include services shared by the current Host.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.RemoteServicesChanged
member.summary: Notifies listeners when remote services become available or unavailable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.OnRemoteServicesChanged(Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.RemoteServicesChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises a event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.GetRemoteServiceAsync``1(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a proxy for a named service provided by a remote Host. The service is available only while a Live Share session is active in the Guest role.
member.remarks:
NOTE: Access to remote services may be restricted. If the caller is not permitted, this method returns null.
Otherwise, a service proxy instance is returned even if the service is not currently available (either because there is no active sharing session or because the host has not provided the service). Check the collection to see if the service is currently available, and listen to the event to be notified when the service becomes available or unavailable. Attempting to call a method on an unavailable service will throw a .
member.param: Name that identifies the remote service, corresponding to the property.
Cancellation token
member.returns: Proxy for the named service, or null if the extension does not have permission to access remote services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.ConvertLocalPathToSharedUri(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a local path to a shared URI with the `vsls:` scheme.
member.param: Local file or directory path
member.returns: Converted URI suitable for sharing between hosts and guests, or null if the path could not be converted, possibly because the path is outside one of the shared roots.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.ConvertSharedUriToLocalPath(System.Uri)
member.summary: Converts a shared `vsls:` URI to a local path.
member.param: Shared URI with the `vsls:` scheme.
member.returns: Local file or directory path.
member.remarks: Note the file or directory may not exist if the file has not been downloaded. Use the method to ensure a file has been downloaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.ListRootsAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Lists the `vsls:` URIs that make up the roots of the shared workspace.
member.returns: Array of one or more workspace root `vsls:` URIs.
member.remarks:
Most commonly a shared workspace has only a single root, which corresponds to the directory of the solution or opened folder, but multiple roots are also possible.
The returned root URI(s) may be converted to local paths using .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.ListDirectoryAsync(System.Uri,Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ListDirectoryOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Lists the files and directories under a specified shared directory.
member.param: `vsls:` URI of a shared directory (or shared root).
Options to filter the listing.
member.returns: Array of `vsls:` URIs of children of the shared directory.
member.exception: If the shared directory does not exist.
member.remarks:
Returned child directory URIs end with a `/` character; in this way they may be distinguished from file URIs.
A shared workspace can potentially contain a very large number of files, so for best performance when using the recursive option also specify pattern(s) to filter the set of results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession.DownloadFileAsync(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Downloads a shared file, if it has not already been downloaded.
member.param: Shared file URI with the `vsls:` scheme.
member.returns: Local file path, or null if the file could not be downloaded, possibly because the file does not exist on the host or is not available to the guest.
member.remarks: If the file is being co-edited then the file contents do not include unsaved changes, but saving the changes will update the downloaded file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ListDirectoryOptions
member.summary: Options for .

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ListDirectoryOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Specifies whether all matching recursive descendants should be included in the results. If false, only immediate children are returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ListDirectoryOptions.IncludeHidden
member.summary: If true, include hidden files in the listing.
member.remarks: Hidden files are not shown in guests' file explorer, but they may still be accessed by guests in other ways. Files are hidden if they have a hidden filesystem attribute or they are matched by the `hideFiles` globs in `.vsls.json`.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ListDirectoryOptions.ExcludePatterns
member.summary: List of glob (.gitignore style) patterns to exclude from results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ListDirectoryOptions.IncludePatterns
member.summary: List of glob (.gitignore style) patterns to include in results.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ExceptionDataKey
member.summary: Exception.Data keys recognized by Live Share

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ExceptionDataKey.CriticalFactoryFailure
member.summary: If there is data with this key (regardless of the value) in an exception thrown from guest CollaborationServiceFactory, the join will fail on the guest and LS may display the exception message. You can provide MEF export to control how LS responds to join failures.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ExportCollaborationServiceAttribute
member.summary: Combines MEF export attribute with export metadata for a collaboration service factory. Declares a type of collaboration service the factory is able to create. The factory class needs to implement .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IFileServiceRootConfigurationProvider
member.summary: Optional file service root configuration provider MEF export. If an export is present, LS will use it to query for file service root configuration before it starts sharing. If multiple providers are present, Live Share will ignore them and trace an error. If the result of is not persistent, it'll be ignored. Sharing will fail if root configuration is present and it is not compatible with what is being shared.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IFileServiceRootConfigurationProvider.GetFileServiceRootConfiguationAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Try get file service root configuration or null if it's not applicable.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootDirectoryConfiguration
member.summary: File service root directory configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootDirectoryConfiguration.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of class.
member.param: Local full path to the directory or drive, e.g. c:\ or d:\foo or d:\foo\bar\. Must be rooted
Uri relative path, e.g. /c$/

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootDirectoryConfiguration.LocalFullPath
member.summary: Local full path to the directory or drive, e.g. c:\ or d:\foo\ or d:\foo\bar\. It is normalized to use Path.DirectorySeparator and ends with it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootDirectoryConfiguration.RemoteUriRelativePath
member.summary: Uri relative path, e.g. /c$/. It is normalized to start and end with '/'.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration
member.summary: File service root configuration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration.Directories
member.summary: Mounted directories if the configuration is for a list of mounted directories.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of class for deserialization.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration.#ctor(Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootDirectoryConfiguration[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance of class for given subdirectories. The configuration is persistan, with full access for owner

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration.TryGetDirectoryByFullPath(System.String,System.Func{System.String,System.StringComparison})
member.summary: Tries to find a directory configuration by the local full path.
member.param: Local full path. Must be rooted and not null.
Optional function to get the path comparison for the given path. If null, Ordinal is used.
member.returns: Directory configuration if there is a match; Otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration.TryGetDirectoryByRemoteUriPath(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to find a directory configuration by the remote URI path.
member.param: Remote URI path. Must be not null. If is normalized to start with '/'.
Offset into , 0-based.
member.returns: Directory configuration if there is a match; Otherwise, null. Also null if is greater than length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration.TryGetLocalPathByRemotePath(System.String,System.Int32,System.Func{System.String,System.StringComparison})
member.summary: Try to get local path from that match at .
member.param: Unescaped remote path, ot null.
Offset in to look for a directory prefix.
Optional function to get the path comparison for the given path. If null, Ordinal is used.
member.returns: Local full path if the directory entry is found, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration.IsSubsetOf(Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.FileServiceRootConfiguration)
member.summary: Check if this configuration is a subset of . This means all directories in this configuration are also present in with the same local paths and remote URI paths.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IClientCollaborationServiceFactory
member.summary:
VS collaboration service factory that can produce different collaboration services for different guests. If result of is a task that returns , Live Share will use this client collaboration service factory to create guest-specific instances of the remote service whenever guests join.
This is only supported on host VS remote service factory attributed with [] that has scope and role.
Client collaboration service factories may optionally implement IDisposable or IAsyncDisposable. If they do, they will be disposed when the collaboration session ends.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IClientCollaborationServiceFactory.CreateServiceAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IClientContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Create a new collaboration service for guest when he or she joins the session. The guest is described by .
member.param: Guest that just joined the session.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Service instance or null. The service instance must implement the service interface declared in exporting that created this instance of .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IClientContext
member.summary: Client context that describes a guest in collaboration session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IClientContext.PeerNumber
member.summary: Peer number that corresponds to in the collection of current collaboration session. Peer numbers are unique for each new guest, even if the same user joins multiple times, or joins, leaves, and joins again.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IClientContext.IsOwner
member.summary: A value indicating whether this owner guest, the guest that uses the same account as the host user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IClientContext.IsOnlineUser
member.summary: A value indicating whther this online user guest.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationService
member.summary: Declares collaboration service attributes and capabilities.
member.remarks:
Currently it is a placeholder for future metadata. This will help us to keep factory interface unchanged.
Collaboration services may optionally implement IDisposable or IAsyncDisposable. If they do, they will be disposed when the collaboration session ends.
If the collaboration service instance was created by in response to a guest joining, it'll be disposed when that guest leaves the session.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceFactory
member.summary: A factory interface as exported by a LiveShare extension component.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceFactory.CreateServiceAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CollaborationSession,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get an instance of the exported service type for the session context or a task with null result.

member.summary: Metadata associated with a MEF export attribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceMetadata.Name
member.summary: The name of the service as registered in a RPC session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceMetadata.ServiceType
member.summary: Collaboration service type the factory creates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceMetadata.Scope
member.summary: Collaboration session scope the factory should be activated for.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceMetadata.Role
member.summary: A role the service fulfills. Can be one of the following: remote service, service proxy or local service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceMetadata.Features
member.summary: List of features the collaboration service contributes to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceMetadata.CreationPriority
member.summary: Priority value that will affect how this collaboration service will be created compared to others being defined

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationServiceMetadata.TargetVersion
member.summary: Range version to consider for this liveshare service

member.summary: Get custom Live Share service endpoint. URI result should be https sub-domain of liveshare.vsengsaas.visualstudio.com. If not, Live Sharew will use the default endpoint.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IHostChannelFactory
member.summary: A host service in Live Share session that allows guests to connect streams to the host.

member.summary: Create a channel with the given name on the host in the active collaboration session. The client needs to configure channel's event and call to start listening.
member.param: The name of the channel, not null or empty. Channel names must be unique within a collaboration session.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IHostChannel
member.summary: Host channel interface. Disposing of it will stop listening on the channel, open streams will also disconnect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IHostChannel.ChannelName
member.summary: The channel name used in .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IHostChannel.Listen
member.summary: Start listening on the channel.
member.exception: Thrown if no event handler has been added to the event.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IHostChannel.GuestConnected
member.summary: Event handler to call when a guest connects a stream to the channel.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.GuestConnectedToHostChannelEventArgs
member.summary: Event args for event on .

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.GuestConnectedToHostChannelEventArgs.Stream
member.summary: Connected stream, not null. The stream is binary, bidirectional, and sequential.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.GuestConnectedToHostChannelEventArgs.PeerNumber
member.summary: Connected guest peer number.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.GuestConnectedToHostChannelEventArgs.IsOwner
member.summary: A value indicating whether connecting guest is the owner.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.GuestConnectedToHostChannelEventArgs.IsOnlineUser
member.summary: A value indicating whether connecting guest is online user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IGuestChannelService
member.summary: A guest service that allows to connect to the channels on the host in a collaboration session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IGuestChannelService.ConnectToChannelAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Connects to a channel on the host. If the channel is not active, waits for the host to start listening on it.
member.param: Channel name
member.returns: Connected stream. The stream is binary, bidirectional, and sequential.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IJoinFailureResponseProvider
member.summary: Optional MEF export to provide response to join failures that may happen if a guest collaboration service factory throws an exception with data set. If joining a session fails like this, LS will iterate over these MEF exports passing the exception until a handler returns non-null task result. If there is a non-null task result, LS will set VS command result to it and may show error dialog or gold bar. If there are no exports, or none returns a task with non-null result, LS will display the exception message in a gold bar similar to other join errors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IJoinFailureResponseProvider.TryGetFailureResponseAsync(System.Exception,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: If join flow failed with an exception from collaboration service factory, check if the exception can be handled, and return non-null object to set LS OLE JoinWorkspace command result and show error dialog.
member.remarks: This code runs on the guest
member.param: Exception thrown by a guest collaboration service factory, not null.
Cancellation token that may be set, e.g. when VS is shutting down.
member.returns: Task that returns non-null to set as the variant result of the join command and, maybe, show an error dialog. Task that returns null to indicate it doesn't know how to response to this exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CommandFailureReporting
member.summary: How command failure should be reported to the user

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CommandFailureReporting.Default
member.summary: Default reporting with a gold bar. The error message comes from the message of collaboration factory exception which has Data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CommandFailureReporting.None
member.summary: No reporting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CommandFailureReporting.CloseSessionWithErrorDialog
member.summary: Close collaboration session with an error dialog. The error message comes from the message of collaboration factory exception which has data. In case of online client, VS will restart after user dismisses the dialog.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CommandFailureResponse
member.summary: How Live Share should handle join command failures

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CommandFailureResponse.OleCommandResult
member.summary: What result to return from join workspace OLE command. This must be convertible to variant with Marshal.GetNativeVariantForObject().

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.CommandFailureResponse.HowToReport
member.summary: A value indicating how Live Share should report the failure.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IServerSharing
member.summary: Interface for sharing local servers. Query it off collaboration session on the host or owner guest side.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IServerSharing.StartSharingAsync(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Start forwarding from localhost: tcp socket.
member.param: Local tcp port to connect to. Not 0 or negative.
Port forwarding session name. Not null or empty.
Browser URL if the server is a browser session. If not null, the guests will be asked if they want to open it in browser.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IServerSharing.StopSharingAsync(System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Stops sharing of the local tcp .
member.param: Port to stop sharing. Not 0 or negative.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IServerSharing2
member.summary: Interface for sharing local servers which also lets the caller know what local tcp port is forwarded to. Query it off collaboration session on the host or owner guest side or cast to it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IServerSharing2.StartSharingAndGetLocalPortNumberAsync(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Start forwarding from localhost: tcp socket and get the local tcp port number (which may be different from ).
member.param: Local tcp port to connect to. Not 0 or negative.
Port forwarding session name. Not null or empty.
Browser URL if the server is a browser session. If not null, the guests will be asked if they want to open it in browser.
member.returns: A task which result is the local tcp port number where port forwarding is set up

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ISettingsService
member.summary: Service that can provide Live Share configuration. Live Share extensions can query for this service from . Importing this service from MEF is allowed, please consider that it'd make VS load several Live Share assemblies. This service is not supported for agent extensions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Peer
member.summary: Information about a participant (host or guest) in a Live Share collaboration session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Peer.PeerNumber
member.summary: Integer that uniquely identifies a peer within the scope of a session. Peer numbers are unique each time a peer joins the session, even if the same user joins multiple times, or joins, leaves, and joins again.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Peer.Identity
member.summary: Authenticated Live Share user identity information.
member.remarks: NOTE: Access to user identity information may be restricted. If the caller is not permitted, this property returns 'null'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Peer.Role
member.summary: Role within the session. Each session has exactly one host; the rest of the peers are guests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Peer.Access
member.summary: Access level within the session. The host has full "owner" access to the session. Guests may have their access limited by the host.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Peer.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Event that notifies listeners when a property on this object changed.
member.remarks: The identity may change when an anonymous user signs in. The access may change when the host changes a guest's access level. The other properties may change when a sharing session starts or ends.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Peer.OnPropertyChanged(System.ComponentModel.PropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises a event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeerAccess
member.summary: Access level of a peer within a Live Share session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeerIdentity.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new peer identity object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeerIdentity.DisplayName
member.summary: User display name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeerIdentity.EmailAddress
member.summary: Validated email address, if known.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeerIdentity.Id
member.summary: User id. This is persistent ID that stays the same for the same user if the user re-joins the session and even between sessions for some time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeerRole
member.summary: Role of a peer within a Live Share session.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeersChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for an event raised when peers join or leave a Live Share session.

member.summary: Constructs a new event args structure with information about changed peers.
member.param: Type of change action, add or remove
List of peers that were added or removed

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeersChangedEventArgs.Action
member.summary: Gets the type of change action. (Only add or remove change events are raised.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.PeersChangedEventArgs.Peers
member.summary: Gets the list of peers that were added or removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ExportCollaborationProtectedOperationAttribute
member.summary: Combines MEF export attribute with export metadata for a ProtectedOperation backed by Live Share access service. Attribute metadata declares when the ProtectedOperation is enabled. The export part needs to implement or may be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ExportCollaborationProtectedOperationAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of for the given .
member.param: Protected operation moniker, not null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperation
member.summary: Protected operation that Live Share access control service can handle. Implementations of this interface must be exported with . Live Share may use it both on the guest and on the host.
member.remarks: We cannot use Microsoft.ServiceHub.Framework.Services.ProtectedOperation directly because it's not available in 15.9 and 16.0 VS. So Live Share will pass operation moniker and required trust level. Also this is only what data on protected operation is passed between peers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperation.GetInsufficientAccessMessage(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Gets a message for the guest telling that they have no access to protected operation.
member.param: Protected operation moniker, not null.
Protected operation required trust level.
member.returns: Not null if the guest can display insufficient access message. Otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperation.GetPermissionGrantedMessage(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Gets a message for the guest telling that the host has granted access to perform a protected operation.
member.param: Protected operation moniker, not null.
Protected operation required trust level.
member.returns: Not null if the guest can display permission granted message. Otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperation.GetPermissionDeniedMessage(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Gets a message for the guest telling that the host has rejected access to perform a protected operation.
member.param: Protected operation moniker, not null.
Protected operation required trust level.
member.returns: Not null if the guest can display permission denied message. Otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperation.IsOperationAllowed(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IExtendedClientContext)
member.summary: Get a value indicating if the protected operation is allowed.
member.param: Protected operation moniker, not null.
Protected operation required trust level.
Client context.
member.returns: True if the operation is allowed. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperation.GetPermissionRequestMessage(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IExtendedClientContext)
member.summary: Get permission request message for the protected operation or null if permission request is not allowed.
member.param: Protected operation moniker, not null.
Protected operation required trust level.
Client context.
member.returns: Not null if the user can request permission on the host. Otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperation.GrantPermanentAccessAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IExtendedClientContext)
member.summary: Grant permission for the protected operation.
member.param: Protected operation moniker, not null.
Protected operation required trust level.
Client context.
member.returns: Task that completes when the permission is granted. Not null.

member.summary: Event that fires when protected operation permission changes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ProtectedOperationPeerRole.AnyUser
member.summary: Any Live Share peer - host, guest, or anynomous guest

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ProtectedOperationPeerRole.HostOrGuestOwner
member.summary: Host or owner guest user, that is, the guest that is the same user as host, like in Codespaces client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ProtectedOperationPeerRole.Host
member.summary: Host user only.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperationMetadata
member.summary: Metadata for

member.summary: Protected operation moniker

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperationMetadata.RequiredTrustLevel
member.summary: Required trust level. Set to true if you set this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperationMetadata.RequiredTrustLevelHasValue
member.summary: A value indicatingh whether the required trust level has value. If true, has the required trust level value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperationMetadata.EnableInReadOnlySession
member.summary: A value indicating that this protected operation is enabled for read-only peers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperationMetadata.RequiresPersistentRootSupport
member.summary: A value indicating that this protected operation is disabled if the file root is not persistent (e.g. remote URIs not like /~~/c$/....)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ICollaborationProtectedOperationMetadata.AllowedPeers
member.summary: Peers that allowed to run the operation.

member.summary: Get a value indicating if the user is read-only .

member.summary: Get a value indicating if the file root is persistent (normally Codespaces only)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IExtendedClientContext.UserDisplayName

member.summary: Exception thrown by a proxy when a request to a shared service cannot be made because the service is not available or cannot be reached.

member.summary: Creates an exception with the default message.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.RemoteServiceProxyException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an exception with an exception message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.RemoteServiceResponseException
member.summary: An exception thrown from a remote method that was propagated back to the caller and rethrown.

member.summary: Creates an exception with the default message and no remote stack trace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.RemoteServiceResponseException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an exception with an exception message and no remote stack trace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.RemoteServiceResponseException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an exception with an exception message and a remote stack trace.

member.summary: Gets the stack trace of the exception that was thrown on the remote side of the RPC call.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.LiveShareServiceMonikers
member.summary: Brokered service monikers

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ServiceRole
member.summary: Characterizes a role a collaboration service fulfills. The Live Share extensibility framework refers to the role value when activating the service in a session context.
member.remarks: The numeric value corresponds to a creation priority used by the extensibility framework when instantiating services in particular order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ServiceRole.RemoteClient
member.summary: Client for a remote RPC service. Activatable in guest sessions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ServiceRole.CoreLocalService
member.summary: Local service (non-RPC) available within current session that other local services and Remote Workspace can use during their initialization. Activatable in both host and guest sessions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ServiceRole.LocalService
member.summary: Local service (non-RPC). Activatable in both host and guest sessions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ServiceRole.RemoteService
member.summary: RPC service that may be called by remote guests. Activatable in host sessions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ServiceRole.RemoteWorkspaceExtension
member.summary: The remote workspace extension (AnyCode workspace provider(s))

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.ServiceRole.RemoteOwnerGuestService
member.summary: The remote service exposed by the owner guest client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.SessionScope
member.summary: Collaboration session scope used to declare collaboration service affinity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.SessionScope.None
member.summary: The service does not have collaboration session affinity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.SessionScope.Host
member.summary: Collaboration session created on a host for sharing a workspace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.SessionScope.Guest
member.summary: Collaboration session created on a guest client for joining a workspace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.SessionScope.All
member.summary: Indicates collaboration service should be activated for both host and guest collaboration sessions.
